title: Poverty-busting woman wins economics Nobel for only the second time in 50 years
text:
A woman has shared in the Nobel prize for economics for only the second time in the 50-year history of the award for work helping to lift millions of people out of poverty.

The French-American economist Esther Duflo, a professor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, claimed the prize with her MIT colleague Abhijit Banerjee, as well as Harvard University’s Michael Kremer, for “their experimental approach to alleviating global poverty".

Ms Duflo becomes only the second woman to be recognised with the discipline’s highest honour after US economist Elinor Ostrom also shared in the prize a decade ago. Alongside the prize the trio share a 9 million-kronor (£728,000) award, a gold medal and...
description: A woman has shared in the Nobel prize for economics for only the second time in the 50-year history of the award for work helping to lift millions of people out of poverty.
